contentList.content: The Duskblade blurs the line between spellcaster and warrior, marrying the power of magic with hand-to-hand combat prowess.
The Elementalist harnesess the raw power of the elements to wrought havoc upon their enemies.
The Necroblade walks the line between life and death. They call upon the power of both to devistate both the living and the undead.

You can only have 1 bound weapon at any time.

The weapon returns to its previous state if you are more than [1] away from it for more than 10 rounds.
You emit a heart-rendering wail that beckons the living to the grave and dealing [1] and possibly stunning enemies.
Infuses your weapon with blood and causes an additional [1].
Imbue your weapon with the fury of the elements. Your weapon is sheathed in fire and deals an additional [1].
Imbue your weapon with the fury of the elements. Your weapon is sheathed in ice and deals an additional [1].
Imbue your weapon with the fury of the elements. Your weapon is sheathed in lightning and deals an additional [1].
Imbue your weapon with the fury of the elements. Your weapon is sheathed in thunderous force and deals an additional [1].
Channel the weave into your strikes, rattling your enemy's brain and causing an additional [1].
Attack an enemy with your weapon to siphon their life force and regain half as many <LSTag Tooltip="HitPoints">hit points</LSTag>.
Attack an enemy with your weapon to siphon their life force and regain half as many <LSTag Tooltip="HitPoints">hit points</LSTag>.
Choose an element at which you wish to excel.
Choose an element at which you wish to excel.
You gain a + [1] to overcome the spell <LSTag Tooltip="Resistant">resistance</LSTag> of your opponents.

The affected entity is immune to Diseases, Poisons and being <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="FRIGHTENED">Frightened</LSTag>, and makes all Wisdom <LSTag Tooltip="SavingThrow">Saving Throws</LSTag> with <LSTag Tooltip="Advantage">Advantage</LSTag>.
This standard-sized breastplate is lined with thick padding meant to cushion the wearer and deflect blows from assailants. The uniform squares of the padding suggest a mathematically-minded crafter.
Years of use in battle have left this hood torn and frayed in some areas. Smells a little of death.
Years of use in battle have left this hood torn and frayed in some areas. Smells a bit like ozone.
You temporarily imbue your weapon with an elemental energy type of your choosing. Your attack will deal an additional 2d8 of that elemental type.
You emit a battle cry to stir awake your allies and stand up from a prone position.
You emit a battle cry to stir awake your allies and stand up from a prone position.
A large glowing fist, the size of a human torso, appears in front of the creature and slams into it with great force, dealing [1] damage.

Spells that cost an action cost a bonus action instead.

Costs [1] Quick Cast Point per spell.
Quick Cast points determine how many times you per long rest that you can quick cast a spell.
You gained the ability to more quickly cast your spells.
The Duskblade blurs the line between spellcaster and warrior, marrying the power of magic with hand-to-hand combat prowess.
Quick cast points can be used to quicken one of your spells.
Binds your weapon to you and allows you to use your intelligence modifier for your attack bonus.
The duskblade bound to this weapon is always <LSTag Tooltip="Proficiency">Proficient</LSTag> with it. The weapon's damage is magical.
